boot.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg
boot.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an enclosed space at the back of a car, used for carrying bags etc
boot.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The new model has a bigger boot.
boot.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a metal object that the police attach to one of the wheels of an illegally parked car so that it cannot be moved
boot.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He bought some sturdy leather boots.
The kids put on their rubber boots and went out in the rain.
In the mountains you’ll need some strong walking boots.
Take your muddy football boots off before you come inside.
Ankle boots are fashionable again this autumn.
I bought a pair of long leather boots.
She looked fabulous in a mini-skirt and knee-high boots.
I really need a new pair of boots this winter.
boot.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to start the program that makes a computer ready to be used
boot.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to kick someone or something hard
boot.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The goalkeeper booted the ball upfield.
boot.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to stop someone from moving their illegally parked vehicle by fixing a piece of equipment to one of the wheels
boot.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if a computer boots, it starts working and is ready to use
boot.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The machine takes a long time to boot up.
boot.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to make a computer ready to be used by getting all the programs it needs into its memory
boot.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: It’s impossible to boot the system from the hard disk.
